sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with no solutions.
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations:

2x + 3y = 7 

4x + 6y = 14 

If there is no solution, state that there is no solution and provide a reason why.
message_2:
There is no unique solution to this system of linear equations because the two equations are dependent, meaning they represent the same line.

To see this, notice that the second equation can be obtained by multiplying the first equation by 2:

(2)(2x + 3y) = (2)(7)
4x + 6y = 14

Since the two equations represent the same line, they have infinitely many solutions that correspond to all the points on the line. There is no unique solution (x, y) that satisfies both equations.
